name: Mirror Dancer
description:
Dance against your reflection!

The prototype of this game was made for the #WeeklyGameJam (Week 145: "Dance") #WGJGame

Because I didn't have time to create a tutorial in-game, here is a rundown of the rules:

You teleport across a grid with different tiles and must rack up more points than your enemy, your reflection.

Every time you start the prototype, there is a 10 round dance-off

Each round consists of 5 phases:

First, a few grid tiles on each side change their states (their states determine how many points are awarded to the dancer which steps on them)

Then, your reflection moves across the grid, racking up points for its round score.

Next, you get 3 seconds to prepare.

Then, it's your turn. You can move as many times as your reflection did, but beware! If you do not mirror your reflection's position by the end of this phase, your achieved points for that round will be halved!

Lastly, both your and your reflection's round score (the points achieved that round) will be added to the total score and the dance begins anew.

NOTE: This prototype is quite luck-dependent and not fair, but I hope you can see some potential in it :D
